definition: lit. robust years/prime of life/summer/able-bodied (fit for military service)/mature (talent, garden etc)
Zhuang ethnic group of Guangxi, the PRC's second most numerous ethnic group

sentences.english: Long into the prime of life, like a baby.
sentences.chinese: 像一個嬰兒長成了壯年。

sentences.english: Have only the men go; and worship the Lord, since that's what you have been asking for.
sentences.chinese: 你們這壯年人去事奉耶和華吧，因爲這是你們所求的。

sentences.english: In 1950, 5% of men at the prime working age were unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 1950年，正值壯年的男性只有5%沒有就業。

sentences.english: Go now, but the men only, and serve Jehovah, since that is what you are requesting.
sentences.chinese: 你們壯年人去事奉耶和華罷，因爲這是你們所求的。

sentences.english: In the great sound of chief, the blue color wooden clansmen are all silence down.
sentences.chinese: 在壯年酋長的大喝聲中，藍色木族人全都安靜下來。

sentences.english: At the early age of forty-three he died of phthisis.
sentences.chinese: 他在四十四歲的壯年因爲肺癆病死去。

sentences.english: However the distribution of old and young makes this picture more complex.
sentences.chinese: 然而老年人和青壯年的分佈情況卻帶來了更多的問題。

sentences.english: He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and by his strength he had power with God
sentences.chinese: 他在腹中抓住哥哥的腳跟，壯年的時候與神較力。

sentences.english: His eye had been worked to death when he was still young.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛過勞死好發於壯年男性。

sentences.english: According to the American Cancer Society, melanoma is one of the most common cancers in young adults today.
sentences.chinese: 美國腫瘤研究學會報告顯示黑色素瘤多發於青壯年。

sentences.english: The marquis of montcalm was in the flower of his age, and in the zenith of his fortune .
sentences.chinese: 當時的蒙卡姆侯爵正是壯年，而且正處於幸運的頂峯。

sentences.english: In ancient times, people rarely lived to be much older than that.
sentences.chinese: 在古代，很少有人活到壯年。

sentences.english: Physical activity is for people in the "prime of life".
sentences.chinese: 身體活動是“風華正茂”的青壯年人的事。

sentences.english: My dad was diagnosed with multiple  sclerosis in the prime of his life.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸被診斷有多種硬化症，當他壯年的時候。

sentences.english: In her heyday, my mother was a fitness fanatic.
sentences.chinese: 青壯年時期，母親是位健身迷。

definition: variant Chinese character/alternative form of a Chinese character
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
I would like to ask (usually used rhetorically)/one might well ask
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to learn a skill or art
